name: Yohimbine
Reason: The target compound is yohimbine, a complex indole alkaloid with multiple ring structures and several polar functional groups. The base unit for comparison might be indole itself, which has a melting point of about 52 degrees Celsius. The complex aromatic structure and multiple chiral centers will significantly increase the melting point due to increased molecular weight, intermolecular pi-stacking, and hydrogen bonding. Substituent groups can notably influence the melting point: -OH groups: +40 each (2 groups, due to the ability to form hydrogen bonds, so +80 total), -O-CO- group: +60 (due to the polar nature and the possibility of hydrogen bonding). Additional steric hindrance and the extended polycyclic system can increase the melting point further by +50. Collectively, these modifications contribute to a substantial increase from the base structure's melting point.
Prediction: 52 (base indole) + 80 (2 x -OH) + 60 (-O-CO-) + 50 (steric hindrance and polycyclic system) = 242 degrees Celsius

name: Yohimbine

Prediction: 52 (base indole) + 80 (2 x -OH) + 60 (-O-CO-) + 50 (steric hindrance and polycyclic system) = 242 degrees Celsius
